general_advisory: Rice Drain out excess water from paddy field & regular surveillance work should be taken up in all crops in order to know the incidence of various disease pests and initiate the control strategies. Increased difference between daily maximum and minimum temperature favours the infestation of blast in main field as well as nursery.

advisory: Spray Tebuconazole 50% + Trifloxystrobin 25% WG @ 80 g/acre in 200 litres of water for leaf blast infestation
Utilize available water for puddling and transplant summer rice with basal application of 35 kg DAP, 20 kg MOP & 10 kg ZnSO4/acre
Collect setts from a healthy cane for planting
Basal drenching with Carbendazim 12% + Mancozeb 63% @ 400 grams/acre for sett rot management
Spray (Tebuconazole + Sulphur) @ 500g/acre to reduce Powdery mildew, Anthracnose & Stem rot incidence
Control aphids with Neem Based Pesticide (Azadirachtin) 1500 PPM @ 600 ml/acre
Spray Dimethoate 30% EC @ 2 ml/lit to control aphids
Spray Neem Oil 1500 PPM @ 600 ml/acre for Mustard Sawfly, Leaf Webber and Tobacco Caterpillar infestation
Spray Acephate @ 250g/acre along with neem oil formulation to minimize damage by Red Pumpkin Beetle in cucurbits
Start sowing tomato seed for summer cultivation in nursery bed
Apply Neem or Karanjaa cake and spray Tebuconazole fungicide @ 1ml/liter to prevent wilting in brinjal and tomato
Treat white spot disease in fish by bathing affected fish in water mixed with salt for 5 minutes
Provide mineral mixture along with salt regularly for animals during winter season
